plugins.name: Page over
plugins.description:
Improve documentation and project management by sharing links to Pages and Prototype flows with one click. Copy to clipboard and paste anywhere!


Page over is a Figma plugin simplifying your handoff workflow and helping everyone find what they are looking for in your file.


Sort things out from A to Z or the other way around for finding what your are looking for faster. Or add a number to every page and point out the exact numbered page, no matter how many pages you have.


To tidy up the structure and visual hierarchy you can add multiple separator pages in different ASCII styles or even create segments of pages with a click of a button.


Improve your documentation and project management by sharing links to all Pages and/or Prototype flows with a single click while respecting your file's privacy and permissions.


The complete list feature includes:


  • Sorting pages A to Z and Z to A
  • Numbering pages
  • Adding separator (blank pages) with predefined styles
  • Adding multiple pages at once (page segment) with predefined or custom colors
  • Export file anatomy to all Pages and/or Prototype flow with one click


Try the beta release and tell us what you think with a mention to @titanas

accepted.name: Stefanos
accepted.description: Making big little things with meraki.

plugins.tagline: Turnaround your handoff workflow by sorting, numbering, adding page segments. Share page links fast.

plugins.name: Currency Formatter
plugins.description:
Currency Formatter


The Currency Formatter plugin simplifies formatting numbers into various currency styles directly within Figma. With just a few clicks, you can ensure your designs are accurate, localized, and visually consistent for different markets.


Key Features

  1. Supports a wide range of global currencies (e.g., $USD, €EUR, ₹INR, £GBP, ¥CNY).
  2. Automatically adds currency symbols and adjusts number formatting.
  3. Live preview of currency formatting directly in your Figma designs.


How It Works

  1. Save your preferred currency in settings.
  2. Use the shortcut `⌘ + P` and type ‘Format Currency’ to apply your settings instantly.


Upcoming Features

  1. Expanded currency support.
  2. Options for decimal formatting.
  3. Flexible choices for symbol positioning and shorthand prefixes.
plugins.tagline: Turn Your Boring Numbers into Fancy Money!

plugins.name: AspectMatic
plugins.description:
AspectMatic is a Figma plugin designed for developers, simplifying aspect ratio calculations. Tired of manual calculations? AspectMatic automates the process.


Features


  1. Separator Options: Choose between colon (:) or slash (/) to format aspect ratios.
  2. Ratio Formats:
  3. Regular Ratio: A simple division format for width and height, such as 300:9 or 300/9.
  4. Reduced Ratio: The simplified version of the regular ratio, like 100:3.
  5. Decimal Form: The ratio expressed as a decimal number, such as 33.33.
  6. Rounded Decimal Form: The decimal ratio rounded to the nearest whole number, such as 33.
  7. Aspect Ratio History: View and manage the history of calculated aspect ratios.
  8. Easy Copy: Quickly copy any aspect ratio to your clipboard for use in your designs.
  9. User-Friendly Interface: Clean and intuitive UI designed to streamline the aspect ratio calculation process.


How it works


  1. Select Node(s): Click on one or more nodes in Figma to start the aspect ratio calculation process.
  2. Choose a Separator: Decide whether to use colon (:) or slash (/) as your ratio separator.
  3. Select a Ratio Form: Pick from one of four ratio forms (Regular Ratio, Reduced Ratio, Decimal, or Rounded Decimal).
  4. Generate and Copy: Click Get AR to calculate the aspect ratio(s). Easily copy the results for use in your projects.


Credits


AspectMatic was developed by Emmanuel Jemeni, a frontend developer.


Built with Create Figma Plugin, Preact, TypeScript, Prettier, and TailwindCSS.


If you find this plugin helpful and would like to support my work, feel free to buy me a coffee.


For any contributions or issues, check out the AspectMatic repository.


  1. LinkedIn: Emmanuel Jemeni
  2. GitHub: @Jemeni11
  3. Twitter/X: @Jemeni11_
plugins.tagline: The Figma plugin that helps developers with aspect ratio calculations.

101546.name: AspectMatic
101546.description:
AspectMatic is a Figma plugin designed for developers, simplifying aspect ratio calculations. Tired of manual calculations? AspectMatic automates the process.


Features


  1. Separator Options: Choose between colon (:) or slash (/) to format aspect ratios.
  2. Ratio Formats:
  3. Regular Ratio: A simple division format for width and height, such as 300:9 or 300/9.
  4. Reduced Ratio: The simplified version of the regular ratio, like 100:3.
  5. Decimal Form: The ratio expressed as a decimal number, such as 33.33.
  6. Rounded Decimal Form: The decimal ratio rounded to the nearest whole number, such as 33.
  7. Aspect Ratio History: View and manage the history of calculated aspect ratios.
  8. Easy Copy: Quickly copy any aspect ratio to your clipboard for use in your designs.
  9. User-Friendly Interface: Clean and intuitive UI designed to streamline the aspect ratio calculation process.


How it works


  1. Select Node(s): Click on one or more nodes in Figma to start the aspect ratio calculation process.
  2. Choose a Separator: Decide whether to use colon (:) or slash (/) as your ratio separator.
  3. Select a Ratio Form: Pick from one of four ratio forms (Regular Ratio, Reduced Ratio, Decimal, or Rounded Decimal).
  4. Generate and Copy: Click Get AR to calculate the aspect ratio(s). Easily copy the results for use in your projects.


Credits


AspectMatic was developed by Emmanuel Jemeni, a frontend developer.


Built with Create Figma Plugin, Preact, TypeScript, Prettier, and TailwindCSS.


If you find this plugin helpful and would like to support my work, feel free to buy me a coffee.


For any contributions or issues, check out the AspectMatic repository.


  1. LinkedIn: Emmanuel Jemeni
  2. GitHub: @Jemeni11
  3. Twitter/X: @Jemeni11_
101546.release_notes:
Hey. Thank you for using AspectMatic 🎉
Here are the new updates:

1. Major UI Overhaul: AspectMatic now has a cleaner interface that feels more like Figma, and dark mode is here! 🌙

2. New Ratio Formats & Separator Options: In previous versions, AspectMatic only supported displaying aspect ratios as Decimal Form and Rounded Decimal Form (e.g., 1.7777 or 1). Now, AspectMatic includes the familiar Regular Ratio format (e.g., 16:9 or 16/9). Additionally, AspectMatic will reduce the ratio to its simplest form (e.g., from 300:9 to 100:3) for a more refined output. You can also choose between two Separator Options — colon (:) or slash (/).

3. Copy Button Added: AspectMatic now includes a dedicated copy button for quick copying of ratios. No more Ctrl + C! (though you can still do that if you'd like).

4. History Modal: A new history modal lets you view your previous aspect ratios without cluttering the main UI. Your old ratios are neatly stored out of sight, accessible when needed, making the experience much more seamless than the old, ever-growing table.

Thank you again for using and supporting AspectMatic! At the time of writing this note, AspectMatic has 201 users, and I hope each and every one of you love these new updates!
101546.tagline: The Figma plugin that helps developers with aspect ratio calculations.

plugins.name: Color Ramp Generator
plugins.description:
Introducing the Color Ramp Generator plugin - designed to streamline your workflow and ensure accessibility across all your designs. This tool allows you to generate a color ramp from any HEX color you provide, ensuring each color meets predefined contrast ratios for accessibility.


Simply enter your HEX code (with or without the “#”), give it a name and the plugin will automatically generate a 15-color gradient. It adjusts the lightness to meet the exact contrast ratios, while preserving the hue and saturation of your colors.


This color system integrates accessibility directly into your design process. In my past projects, clients often provided incomplete brand guidelines, especially regarding accessibility. To solve this, I created a method to generate accessible color ramps, assigning each shade a number for easy reference. I specifically built this system to support white-labeling requirements, enabling quick and easy customization for different brands while maintaining accessibility standards.


Each color in the palette is numbered from 5 to 100, with the darkest color assigned “5” and the brightest color assigned “100.”


Here’s the key feature: a points-based color system.

• A 40-point difference between shades meets a 3:1 contrast ratio.

• A 50-point difference meets a 4.5:1 ratio.

• A 60-point difference meets a 7:1 ratio.


This system allows you to easily achieve AA and AAA accessibility standards by assigning colors to objects accordingly.


Cross-Palette Accessibility: This feature ensures that colors from different palettes are also accessible when combined. For example, Color 30 from one palette and Color 80 from another palette will automatically have a 50-point difference, which meets the 4.5:1 contrast ratio requirement. This makes it easy to mix colors from different palettes while maintaining accessibility.


The output generated is clean and ready for use in your design system, ensuring that your designs not only meet accessibility standards but also look polished and professional.


With this system, you can reduce your toolkit setup time from days to under a minute, saving 99% of the time.
plugins.tagline: Create color shades to establish a color system.

plugins.name: Bitcoin UI Kit
plugins.description:
This is a companion plugin to the Bitcoin UI Kit, which is also published on Figma community. It is specifically made to work with that file.


The primary feature is for easily switching themes with one click. Themes can be color palettes, typography, button styles, and more, and several variations are included in the UI Kit.


Several other helper tools are also included to keep the design system clean and organized:

  • Finding unstyled text
  • Finding component instances
  • Finding instances whose main components are missing or in external files
  • Links to the Bitcoin Design Guide and Bitcoin UI Kit websites for reference
  • Preparing screens for export to bitcoinuikit.com


This is the first iteration of this plugin. Share your feedback on what tools you'd like to see added, and we will add them in.

plugins.name: Bannners
plugins.description:
Banner Generator

Easily create custom banners in any size and shape for your creative campaigns.


Setup Requirements

For optimal performance, please follow these guidelines:

Layer Names (Important):

  1. Logo
  2. Heading
  3. Subtext
  4. CTA (Call-to-Action)
  5. Product
  6. Pattern
  7. Background

Component Structure (Important):

  1. Images and groups should be components (e.g., Logo, Product, Background, Patterns)
  2. Heading and Subtext can be free-standing text layers
  3. CTA works best as an Auto Layout


Key Features

  1. Generate banners in both portrait and landscape orientations
  2. Align elements to suit your design needs
  3. Resize banners effortlessly


Check the demo file for reference: https://www.figma.com/design/vpgRYtBzv5iQQE1wsDCPUV/Crafttor-Banner?node-id=0-1&t=AVGyvfVGR0Dta6vJ-1


We're Just Getting Started!

Your feedback is crucial in shaping the future of this plugin. Help us improve by sharing your thoughts at info@crafttor.om. Stay tuned for updates and new features!

Download and start creating stunning banners today!

plugins.name: Figma to Storyblok
plugins.description:
Figma to Storyblok bridges the gap between design and content management. With just one click, you can export Figma components directly into your Storyblok space, instantly turning them into ready-to-use content blocks.


How to use the Figma to Storyblok Sync plugin:


1. Install the plugin 

Once installed, click Get Started in Figma, go through our onboarding slider, and click Connect Account in the final step.


2. Connect your account 

Use your Personal Access Token, generated in your Storyblok account, to enable a secure and seamless integration.


3. Export from Figma to Storyblok 

Select and export one frame at a time. In Storyblok, each frame becomes a universal block you can use as a component, with an auto-updated image preview.


Have feedback or need help?

Contact us at figma@storyblok.com

accepted.name: Storyblok
accepted.description:
Empowering teams with joyful headless CMS to create, scale, and deliver bigger, faster market impact. 🚀 Let’s connect! 

#Storyblok #HeadlessCMS

plugins.name: Mermaid to FigJam
plugins.description:
## ✨ New Features


### FigJam → Mermaid Conversion

- **Section-based conversion**: Select any FigJam Section and convert all flowchart elements within it to Mermaid code

- **Smart node mapping**: Automatically generates clean, sequential node IDs (A, B, C... AA, AB... for 26+ nodes)

- **Shape recognition**: Correctly identifies rectangles, diamonds, and circles from FigJam shapes

- **Connection preservation**: Maintains all connections with labels and arrow types

- **Large diagram support**: Handles flowcharts with 100+ nodes efficiently


### Enhanced UI/UX

- **Dynamic button states**: FigJam → Mermaid button is enabled only when a Section is selected

- **Improved UI layout**: Cleaner interface with Sample Flowchart and Clear links

- **Real-time feedback**: Clear status messages for successful conversions

- **Bilingual support**: Works seamlessly with both English and Japanese text


### Technical Improvements

- **Robust error handling**: Graceful handling of edge cases and missing connections

- **Performance optimizations**: Efficient processing of large diagrams

- **Debug logging**: Comprehensive logging for troubleshooting (in development mode)


## 🔄 Conversion Capabilities


### Mermaid → FigJam (Enhanced)

- Automatic Section creation with timestamp

- Optimized layout algorithm with branch/merge point detection

- Smart connector routing to minimize overlaps

- Support for all Mermaid node shapes and connection types


### FigJam → Mermaid (New)

- Clean Mermaid code generation

- Preserves flowchart structure and logic

- Handles complex branching and merging patterns

- Maintains connection labels and directionality


## 📋 Usage


1. **Mermaid → FigJam**: Paste your Mermaid code and click convert

2. **FigJam → Mermaid**: Select a Section containing your flowchart and click convert

3. **Sample Flowchart**: Click to insert a sample Mermaid diagram

4. **Clear**: Reset the text area for new input


## 🛠️ Technical Details


- **Node ID Generation**: Intelligent mapping system supporting unlimited nodes

- **Shape Mapping**: FigJam shapes are correctly interpreted as Mermaid syntax

- **Section Detection**: Automatic detection of selected Sections for conversion

- **Color Scheme**: Light blue nodes (#C2E5FF) with blue connectors (#3DADFF)


## 🐛 Bug Fixes


- Fixed node positioning issues within Sections

- Resolved connector overlap problems in complex diagrams

- Corrected shape detection for rounded rectangles

- Fixed text encoding issues for Japanese characters


## 🔧 Requirements


- FigJam (Figma) desktop or web application

- Sections must be used for FigJam → Mermaid conversion


## 🚀 Getting Started


1. Install the plugin in FigJam

2. Try the Sample Flowchart to see the conversion in action

3. Use your own Mermaid code or convert existing FigJam diagrams

plugins.name: Handoff Focus
plugins.description:
"Handoff Focus" is a Figma plugin designed to streamline the handoff process between designers and developers. This plugin creates a dedicated handoff page that consolidates all elements marked as "Ready for Development", making it easier for developers to focus on what's ready for implementation.


How to Use


  1. Mark Layers: Use the native Figma feature to mark elements as "Ready for Development."
  2. (optional) Toggle Visibility: Click the visibility icon to hide or show layers based on their development status.
  3. Create Handoff Page: Input a name and click "Create" to generate a handoff page that includes all marked layers.
  4. Customize: Use the "Keep Original Position" option if you want to maintain the original layout of layers on the handoff page.
  5. Review & Share: Once the handoff page is created, review it and share it with developers.


Core Features


  • Visibility Toggle: Options to hide or show layers based on their marked status.
  • Handoff Page Generation: Create a dedicated handoff page with all marked layers.
  • Position Customization: Option to keep the original position of layers on the handoff page.
  • Page Title Annotations: Add page titles to the handoff page for organization. (Disabled when "Keep Original Position" is active.)


Key Benefits


  1. Enhanced Concentration: By hiding non-essential layers, you can zero in on what's crucial, reducing visual noise and enhancing your focus.
  2. Efficiency: No need to manually sift through layers or groups to find what's ready for development. The plugin does the heavy lifting, saving you time and effort.
  3. Collaboration: Makes it easier for designers and developers to collaborate. Developers can quickly view only the layers that are relevant to them, ensuring a smoother handoff process.
  4. Flexibility: Whether you want to hide or show layers, the plugin offers quick toggle options, giving you full control over your workspace visibility.
  5. Lightweight: Designed with performance in mind, "Handoff Focus" ensures a seamless experience even in large documents, without bogging down your Figma app.

accepted.name: Sascha Wohlgemuth
accepted.description: UX Designer @ Hoffmann Group

plugins.tagline: Highlight ready layers; hide the rest. Streamline your handoff process.

plugins.name: Tempura Generator
plugins.description:
Download local styles as swift code, and save time.


A lifesaver for developers.

Tempura Generator lets you download local styles as swift code—no more time wasted with annoying typos and boring repetition. Just plug in and play.

When styling specific labels with local styles, Tempura Generator generates the code for the label, so you can paste it immediately into the scene you’re developing.


INSTRUCTIONS


* To download the Color Style catalog, select the Color Style header and click Download Archive. Unzip the downloaded Archive, and copy and paste its contents into the project. You can then access these colors and use them by typing <>


* The same procedure applies for text styles. Select Text Styles, Download File, and copy and paste it into the project. You can then access these text styles by typing <>


* You can generate a code to compose a label inside the UI of a scene by doing the following: Select the label you want to code, then select Code Header in the plugin, make your choices, and click Copy Style.


WHY USE TEMPURA GENERATOR?


Developers are always seeking out ways to save time. Tempura Generator delivers, big-time. As soon as the styles are added to the project, anyone in the team can use it immediately. So if you’re looking for ways to make your team more efficient, Tempura Generator is a must-have.


For example, if the designer changes the accent color from red to yellow, you don’t need to manually make these changes everywhere. Simply re-download the archive, paste its contents into the project, and it will immediately update all the instances of red, with the new yellow.

* The same procedure applies for text styles. Select Text Styles, Download File, and copy and paste it into the project. You can then access these text styles by typing <>


* You can generate a code to compose a label inside the UI of a scene by doing the following: Select the label you want to code, then select Code Header in the plugin, make your choices, and click Copy Style.


WHY USE TEMPURA GENERATOR?


Developers are always seeking out ways to save time. Tempura Generator delivers, big-time. As soon as the styles are added to the project, anyone in the team can use it immediately. So if you’re looking for ways to make your team more efficient, Tempura Generator is a must-have.


For example, if the designer changes the accent color from red to yellow, you don’t need to manually make these changes everywhere. Simply re-download the archive, paste its contents into the project, and it will immediately update all the instances of red, with the new yellow.

plugins.name: Frame Generator
plugins.description:
This plugin is ideal for generating a batch of display ads, but it's also versatile enough for other applications.


Simply provide a list of sizes, each on a new line, formatted as widthxheight, and the plugin will create frames of those sizes.


Moreover, you can specify unique names along with the sizes, and the plugin will name the frames accordingly.


For example:

JBL-Summer-200x300

JBL-Summer-1200x400


This will result in two frames sized 200x300 and 1200x400, named "JBL-Summer-200x300" and "JBL-Summer-1200x400" respectively.

plugins.name: Export to WebP
plugins.description:
Export to WebP transforms your Figma frames into optimised WebP images with just a few clicks.


WebP offers significantly smaller file sizes compared to PNG while maintaining excellent visual quality - perfect for web projects where performance matters.


Key Features


Smart Target File Size Optimisation ✨ NEW

•Set your desired file size (e.g., "100 KB" or "2 MB") and let the plugin automatically find the perfect quality setting

•Advanced binary search algorithm optimises quality to hit your exact target size

•Real-time progress feedback shows optimisation iterations

•Perfect for meeting specific file size requirements or bandwidth constraints

⠀

Advanced Transparency Control ✨ NEW

•Preserve or remove alpha channel (transparency) based on your needs

•Keep transparent backgrounds for overlays and UI elements

•Remove transparency for smaller file sizes when opacity isn't needed

•Smart default settings optimize for most common use cases


Efficient WebP Conversion

•Convert any Figma element to WebP format with high-quality results

•Save up to 30-75% in file size compared to PNG format

•Maintain visual quality while dramatically reducing file sizes


Flexible Quality Settings

•Choose from preset quality options (High Quality, Web Optimised, Ultra Compressed)

•Fine-tune compression with a precise quality slider (0-100%)

•Create and save custom quality presets for your specific needs


Batch Processing

•Convert multiple elements simultaneously

•Real-time progress tracking with accurate completion estimates

•Optimised memory usage for handling large selections


Export Options

•Save as a single ZIP file containing all WebP images

•Download individual WebP files directly

•Automatic naming based on your Figma layer structure


Detailed Statistics

•View before/after file size comparisons

•See exact file size savings for each conversion

•Track total compression savings across your selection


Simple Workflow

•Select elements → Choose quality → Convert → Download

•Integrates seamlessly with your Figma workflow

•Works with frames, components, groups, shapes, text, and more


Performance Optimised

•Fast conversions even for high-resolution graphics

•Memory-efficient processing for large batches


Please leave some feedback if you find this plugin useful :)
plugins.tagline: Convert your designs to WebP - smaller files, same quality

plugins.name: Fig Tool
plugins.description:
Fig Tool – All-in-One Figma Design Assistant with Flip UI to RTL feature: https://sites.google.com/view/fig-tool/home

A comprehensive plugin to speed up your Figma workflow with smart selection, editing, color control, and RTL support. With LANGUAGE TRANSLATION


Overview

Fig Tool is built to supercharge your design process with a collection of powerful utilities, all within a responsive and intuitive interface. Whether you're managing components, flipping layouts for RTL languages, or batch-editing styles, Fig Tool adapts to your workflow with horizontal and vertical layout modes.


🔑 Key Features

Smart Selection

All Text: Select every text layer in a frame


By Alignment: Filter text layers by left, center, or right alignment


All Components: Select all component instances, including nested ones


First Layer Components: Focus on top-level component instances


Flip In Place: Horizontally flip elements without moving them


Reverse Align: Switch text alignment direction


Component Breaking

Detach Components: Break components for editing flexibility


Options: Selected only, All, First Layer


Ungroup Objects: Break apart group structures


Unframe Elements: Flatten frames for direct editing


Color Control

Adjust hue, saturation, and lightness (HSB sliders)


Target fills, strokes, effects, or all at once


Apply changes to multiple elements with one click


Lorem Ipsum Generator

Insert placeholder text with start customization


Add/remove word count


Smart fill to match text box dimensions


Copy/Paste Styles

Copy from a source element


Paste to multiple targets


Choose specific properties:


Effects, Fills, Strokes


Corners, Layout, Opacity, Blend Modes


Prefix/Suffix Name Manager

Add or remove prefixes and suffixes in bulk


Clean up layer naming for consistent organization


🌐 Flip UI – RTL Support

Convert left-to-right (LTR) layouts to right-to-left (RTL) for languages like Arabic or Hebrew:


Detaches all components for accurate mirroring


Flips layout horizontally


Adjusts text alignment (left ↔ right)


Handles images and containers intelligently


⚠️ Important: This feature detaches components. Use a duplicate frame to preserve your original design.


📦 Fig Box – Visual Element Library

A personal design library for frequently used elements:


Add to Fig Box: Save selected elements


Insert or Replace: Drop items into current designs or replace existing ones


Search & Organize: Quickly find stored elements


Stored locally – private to your device and persistent across sessions


🖥️ Dual Interface Modes

Choose a layout that fits your screen and workflow:


Horizontal Mode: Toolbar across the top for quick access


Vertical Mode: Compact sidebar for focused editing

Switch easily using the ⇄ layout switcher. Expand or shrink the panel using the ⇔ toggle.


💡 Tips for Efficient Use

Use selection filters before applying edits for better precision


Flip designs for RTL only on duplicated frames


Organize Fig Box items with meaningful names for faster reuse


Combine name management with selection tools to apply naming systems quickly


❓ Frequently Asked Questions (FAQs)

Q: Do both layout modes offer the same features?

Yes, both modes offer full access. Choose based on your screen size or personal preference.


Q: Will detaching components affect my master library?

No, it only affects instances in your selection. Original components remain untouched.


Q: Can I apply color changes to multiple items at once?

Absolutely. Just select all relevant elements and apply your HSB edits.


Q: Does Fig Box store my elements online?

No, all Fig Box items are stored locally in your browser, keeping your designs private and fast.


Q: How does the plugin generate Lorem Ipsum text?

It calculates based on your text box's size and font properties to fit naturally within the design.


🔔 What’s New in This Major Release

🚀 Fig Tool 2.0 – More than just RTL!


Previously known as "Flip UI – Make It RTL", the plugin now includes 20+ features to boost productivity


Renamed to "Fig Tool" to reflect its wider utility beyond RTL support


Smart selection, color manipulation, Fig Box, and batch operations added


📞 Contact & Support

For questions, feature suggestions, or bug reports, reach out via the Figma Community.


Fig Tool — Design faster, smarter, and with more control.

All the tools you need. In one place.
plugins.tagline: Fig Tool - All-in-One Figma Design Assistant with One Click Flip UI - RTL Feature

plugins.description:
Take control of your text with this all-in-one plugin! 🥁


📖 Changelog v6.0

  1. Added Text Style Preservation: Keep font styles, weights, and sizes intact during transformations.
  2. Added Color Fill Preservation: Highlighted words retain their specific color fills after formatting.



Apply common text formats instantly:

  1. Title Case: Capitalize each word (excluding conjunctions & acronyms) for a polished look.
  2. Sentence Case: Start sentences with a capital while keeping acronyms intact.
  3. Uppercase/Lowercase: Convert text to all caps or lowercase for emphasis or consistency.
  4. Line Break Control: Add or remove line breaks for precise paragraph formatting.
  5. Extra Space Remover: Eliminate unwanted spaces, ensuring clean and readable text.

  1. Save Time & Effort: Say goodbye to manual text formatting—let the plugin handle it in seconds!
  2. Consistent Results: Ensure your designs always look professional and cohesive.
  3. Style & Highlight Retention: Maintain your original text styles and highlights, even after applying formatting.



📧 Feedback & Support

We value your feedback! For any bugs, suggestions, or help using the plugin, feel free to reach out to us at ujaydip9@gmail.com.

plugins.name: OK Palette
plugins.description:
OK Palette is a plugin that helps designers create tonal palettes for GUI design with greater control, yet in a simple and fast way. OK Palette uses OKLCH, a Perceptually Uniform Colorspace, allowing designers to easily generate tonal palettes based on Lightness, Chroma, and Hue.


Color spaces like HSB, HSL, and HSV have been widely used because of the perceived advantage of maintaining saturation and brightness while changing hues, unlike RGB. However, this is not entirely true. For instance, take HSB(60, 100, 100) in yellow and HSB(240, 100, 100) in blue. Although both have the same brightness (B) value of 100, our eyes know the truth: yellow appears brighter.


In contrast, OKLCH is a perceptually uniform color space that ensures any color with the same L value will appear at the same brightness to the human eye, regardless of hue (H). This is a crucial feature for GUI design because humans are more sensitive to differences in brightness than other attributes of color, like hue or saturation, and often rely on brightness to perceive importance.


OKLCH is already a web standard available on all browsers. Unfortunately, however, Figma does not yet offer native support for the OKLCH color space. Luckily, a few plugins enable the use of OKLCH. Notably, OkColor by DokoZero is an excellent plugin that we used before creating OK Palette, though we had to manually calculate each tonal palette (one by one). Although it does not use the OKLCH color space, Material Theme Builder by Material Design is another plugin that generates tonal palettes. It uses Google's custom HCT color space, which is also a perceptually uniform color space. However, HCT is not a web standard, and it is so automated that it provides designers with very limited control.


Despite the existence of such plugins, we created OK Palette because no existing plugin met all of the following criteria:


1. Automate the creation of tonal palettes based on the OKLCH color space for quick and easy palette generation.

2. Allow designers almost full control by enabling direct visual exploration of the OKLCH color space.


OK Palette was developed by Professor SON OO-SUNG and student Choi Eunjin from the Department of Communication Design at Sangmyung University's College of Design. We welcome your feedback. If you have any suggestions or encounter any issues, please reach out via GitHub or email.


Key Features

Palette generation with automatic saturation adjustment based on lightness

OK Palette generates a tonal palette that starts from absolute black (#000000) and ends in absolute white (#FFFFFF). Users can adjust the Lightness and Chroma values at intermediate points along the palette’s path to create a variety of tonal palettes.


Hue adjustments based on changes in lightness

Typical tonal palettes maintain the same hue from start to end, but we wondered, "Does it really have to be that way?" OK Palette offers the flexibility to set different hues at the starting point (Hue Start) and the endpoint (Hue End).


APCA matrix generation

OK Palette automatically generates an APCA matrix for all possible combinations within the tonal palette.




OK Palette는 GUI 디자인을 위한 토널 팔레트를 만드는 데 있어 디자이너에게 더 많은 통제권을 부여하면서도 쉽고 빠르게 만들 수 있도록 돕는 플러그인입니다. OK Palette는 지각적 균일 색 공간(Perceptually Uniform Colorspace)인 OKLCH를 활용해 명도(Lightness), 채도(Chroma), 색상(Hue)을 기반으로 한 토널 팔레트를 손쉽게 생성할 수 있게 해줍니다.


기존에 많이 사용되던 HSB, HSL, HSV 등의 색 공간은 RGB에 비해 채도, 명도를 유지한 채 색상을 변경할 수 있다는 이유로 널리 사용되어 왔지만, 이는 사실이 아닙니다. HSB를 예로 들면, HSB(60, 100, 100)인 노란색과 HSB(240, 100, 100)인 파란색은 분명히 100이라는 같은 B(명도) 값을 가지고 있지만, 우리 눈은 답을 알고 있습니다. 노란색이 더 밝습니다.


반면에 OKLCH 색 공간은 지각적 균일 색 공간으로서 같은 L 값을 가진 색은 어떤 색상(H)일지라도 우리 눈으로 보기에도 같은 밝기일 것을 보장합니다. 이는 GUI 디자인에서 매우 중요하고 유용한 특징입니다. 왜냐하면 인간은 색상이나 채도 등 색의 다른 속성보다도 밝기의 차이를 민감하게 인지하고, 이를 바탕으로 중요도를 인식하기 때문입니다.


OKLCH는 이미 모든 브라우저에서 사용할 수 있는 웹 표준입니다만, 아쉽게도 피그마는 아직 OKLCH 색 공간을 기본 기능으로 제공하지 않습니다. 그러나 다행히도 OKLCH 색 공간을 사용할 수 있는 몇몇 플러그인이 존재합니다. 특히 DokoZero의 OkColor는 매우 훌륭한 플러그인으로, 우리가 OK Palette를 만들기 전에는 이 플러그인을 이용해 (일일이 하나하나 계산해야 했지만) 토널 팔레트를 만들었습니다. OKLCH 색 공간을 활용하는 것은 아니지만, Material Design의 Material Theme Builder는 토널 팔레트를 생성해주는 플러그인으로 구글이 독자적으로 개발한 HCT 색 공간을 활용하고 있으며, 이 또한 지각적 균일 색 공간입니다. 다만, HCT 색 공간은 웹 표준이 아닐 뿐더러, 너무 자동화되어 디자이너에게 거의 통제권을 제공하지 않습니다.


이 같은 플러그인들이 있음에도 우리가 OK Palette를 만든 이유는 다음의 조건들을 모두 만족하는 플러그인이 없었기 때문입니다.

  1. OKLCH 색 공간에 기초한 토널 팔레트를 자동화하여 쉽고 빠르게 만들 수 있게 할 것.
  2. OKLCH 색 공간을 시각적으로 직접 탐색할 수 있게 함으로써 디자이너에게 거의 모든 통제권을 제공할 것.


OK Palette는 상명대학교 디자인대학 커뮤니케이션디자인전공의 손우성 교수와 최은진 학생이 개발했습니다. 우리는 여러분의 피드백을 기다리고 있습니다. 불편한 점이나 필요한 기능이 있다면 GitHub이나 이메일로 연락해 주시기 바랍니다.


주요 기능


명도에 따른 채도의 자동 조절로 팔레트 생성

OK Palette는 #000000인 완전 흑색에서 시작하여 #FFFFFF인 완전 백색에서 끝나는 토널 팔레트를 생성합니다. 사용자는 이 토널 팔레트가 지나는 중간 지점의 명도(Lightness)와 채도(Chroma)를 설정하여 다양한 토널 팔레트를 생성할 수 있습니다.


색상(Hue)의 명도 변화에 따른 조절 기능

일반적인 토널 팔레트는 시작부터 끝까지 같은 색상(Hue)을 유지하지만, 우리는 “꼭 그래야만 하나?”라고 생각했습니다. OK Palette에서는 시작 지점의 색상(Hue Start)과 끝 지점의 색상(Hue End)을 다르게 설정할 수 있는 기능도 제공합니다.


APCA 매트릭스 생성

생성된 토널 팔레트의 가능한 모든 조합에 대한 APCA 매트릭스를 자동으로 생성해줍니다.
plugins.tagline: Generates tonal palettes based on the OKLCH color space

117461.name: OK Palette
117461.description:
OK Palette is a plugin that helps designers create tonal palettes for GUI design with greater control, yet in a simple and fast way. OK Palette uses OKLCH, a Perceptually Uniform Colorspace, allowing designers to easily generate tonal palettes based on Lightness, Chroma, and Hue.


Color spaces like HSB, HSL, and HSV have been widely used because of the perceived advantage of maintaining saturation and brightness while changing hues, unlike RGB. However, this is not entirely true. For instance, take HSB(60, 100, 100) in yellow and HSB(240, 100, 100) in blue. Although both have the same brightness (B) value of 100, our eyes know the truth: yellow appears brighter.


In contrast, OKLCH is a perceptually uniform color space that ensures any color with the same L value will appear at the same brightness to the human eye, regardless of hue (H). This is a crucial feature for GUI design because humans are more sensitive to differences in brightness than other attributes of color, like hue or saturation, and often rely on brightness to perceive importance.


OKLCH is already a web standard available on all browsers. Unfortunately, however, Figma does not yet offer native support for the OKLCH color space. Luckily, a few plugins enable the use of OKLCH. Notably, OkColor by DokoZero is an excellent plugin that we used before creating OK Palette, though we had to manually calculate each tonal palette (one by one). Although it does not use the OKLCH color space, Material Theme Builder by Material Design is another plugin that generates tonal palettes. It uses Google's custom HCT color space, which is also a perceptually uniform color space. However, HCT is not a web standard, and it is so automated that it provides designers with very limited control.


Despite the existence of such plugins, we created OK Palette because no existing plugin met all of the following criteria:


1. Automate the creation of tonal palettes based on the OKLCH color space for quick and easy palette generation.

2. Allow designers almost full control by enabling direct visual exploration of the OKLCH color space.


OK Palette was developed by Professor SON OO-SUNG and student Choi Eunjin from the Department of Communication Design at Sangmyung University's College of Design. We welcome your feedback. If you have any suggestions or encounter any issues, please reach out via GitHub or email.


Key Features

Palette generation with automatic saturation adjustment based on lightness

OK Palette generates a tonal palette that starts from absolute black (#000000) and ends in absolute white (#FFFFFF). Users can adjust the Lightness and Chroma values at intermediate points along the palette’s path to create a variety of tonal palettes.


Hue adjustments based on changes in lightness

Typical tonal palettes maintain the same hue from start to end, but we wondered, "Does it really have to be that way?" OK Palette offers the flexibility to set different hues at the starting point (Hue Start) and the endpoint (Hue End).


APCA matrix generation

OK Palette automatically generates an APCA matrix for all possible combinations within the tonal palette.




OK Palette는 GUI 디자인을 위한 토널 팔레트를 만드는 데 있어 디자이너에게 더 많은 통제권을 부여하면서도 쉽고 빠르게 만들 수 있도록 돕는 플러그인입니다. OK Palette는 지각적 균일 색 공간(Perceptually Uniform Colorspace)인 OKLCH를 활용해 명도(Lightness), 채도(Chroma), 색상(Hue)을 기반으로 한 토널 팔레트를 손쉽게 생성할 수 있게 해줍니다.


기존에 많이 사용되던 HSB, HSL, HSV 등의 색 공간은 RGB에 비해 채도, 명도를 유지한 채 색상을 변경할 수 있다는 이유로 널리 사용되어 왔지만, 이는 사실이 아닙니다. HSB를 예로 들면, HSB(60, 100, 100)인 노란색과 HSB(240, 100, 100)인 파란색은 분명히 100이라는 같은 B(명도) 값을 가지고 있지만, 우리 눈은 답을 알고 있습니다. 노란색이 더 밝습니다.


반면에 OKLCH 색 공간은 지각적 균일 색 공간으로서 같은 L 값을 가진 색은 어떤 색상(H)일지라도 우리 눈으로 보기에도 같은 밝기일 것을 보장합니다. 이는 GUI 디자인에서 매우 중요하고 유용한 특징입니다. 왜냐하면 인간은 색상이나 채도 등 색의 다른 속성보다도 밝기의 차이를 민감하게 인지하고, 이를 바탕으로 중요도를 인식하기 때문입니다.


OKLCH는 이미 모든 브라우저에서 사용할 수 있는 웹 표준입니다만, 아쉽게도 피그마는 아직 OKLCH 색 공간을 기본 기능으로 제공하지 않습니다. 그러나 다행히도 OKLCH 색 공간을 사용할 수 있는 몇몇 플러그인이 존재합니다. 특히 DokoZero의 OkColor는 매우 훌륭한 플러그인으로, 우리가 OK Palette를 만들기 전에는 이 플러그인을 이용해 (일일이 하나하나 계산해야 했지만) 토널 팔레트를 만들었습니다. OKLCH 색 공간을 활용하는 것은 아니지만, Material Design의 Material Theme Builder는 토널 팔레트를 생성해주는 플러그인으로 구글이 독자적으로 개발한 HCT 색 공간을 활용하고 있으며, 이 또한 지각적 균일 색 공간입니다. 다만, HCT 색 공간은 웹 표준이 아닐 뿐더러, 너무 자동화되어 디자이너에게 거의 통제권을 제공하지 않습니다.


이 같은 플러그인들이 있음에도 우리가 OK Palette를 만든 이유는 다음의 조건들을 모두 만족하는 플러그인이 없었기 때문입니다.

  1. OKLCH 색 공간에 기초한 토널 팔레트를 자동화하여 쉽고 빠르게 만들 수 있게 할 것.
  2. OKLCH 색 공간을 시각적으로 직접 탐색할 수 있게 함으로써 디자이너에게 거의 모든 통제권을 제공할 것.


OK Palette는 상명대학교 디자인대학 커뮤니케이션디자인전공의 손우성 교수와 최은진 학생이 개발했습니다. 우리는 여러분의 피드백을 기다리고 있습니다. 불편한 점이나 필요한 기능이 있다면 GitHub이나 이메일로 연락해 주시기 바랍니다.

plugins.name: Gridly
plugins.description:
Gridly makes content management and localization a continuous and streamlined process. By centralizing content in one place, Gridly ensures updates are synchronized seamlessly across languages and projects.


Manage content like a spreadsheet

With Gridly’s user-friendly, spreadsheet-like interface, you can manage content in multiple languages, enrich translations with additional data, or run automated actions such as machine translation or generative AI.


Localize Figma designs in minutes

Bridge the gap between your design process and localization workflows with Gridly for Figma. Push text in selected layers and their screenshots to Gridly. Group duplicated texts and pull back updated translations or proofread text to your Figma project, allowing you to check if your design works in other languages. 


Build agile localization workflow

Keep the text in your designs up-to-date across all your languages with real-time change tracking in Gridly. Leverage built-in QA and translation tools, and effortlessly deploy localized content to your build pipeline.


Connect your Figma designs to Gridly’s content management and localization platform using the Figma plugin. Enabling you to:


  • Instantly push text from selected layers in Figma to Gridly
  • Generate screenshots of synced objects and store them in Gridly
  • Group duplicated source texts to save time on translation
  • Pull back updated text and translations from Gridly
  • View localized Figma designs in multiple languages
  • Centralize text content from multiple Figma designs in one place


Sign up for Gridly today, download the Figma plugin, and experience the power of a streamlined localization workflow.


Get started now:

  • Sign up to Gridly here
  • Learn more about how a localization workflow works
  • Read more about how the plugin works here
plugins.tagline: Localize Figma designs in minutes: sync, view, and manage multilingual content using Gridly.

plugins.name: Volcano for Figma
plugins.description:
什么是火山引擎-国际化翻译平台


火山引擎旗下的国际化翻译平台为用户提供高效专业的【平台+服务】解决方案，简化本地化管理流程，提高多语言内容管理效率，助力产品国际化转型。


前往国际化翻译平台


什么是 Volcano for Figma


Volcano for Figma 是一个连接国际化翻译平台和 Figma 的文案推送和 UI本地化插件。体验或内容设计师可将 Figma 中的文本作为源文案推送至翻译平台，支持按需定义 Key、上传截图等；同时，插件可通过机器翻译或翻译平台的译文快速将设计稿显示为不同语言的界面，帮助检查多语言效果，节省设计师、产品经理、译员和开发人员之间的沟通成本，帮助团队快速交付多语言产品。


这个插件可以：


  1. Figma → 翻译平台：扫描并推送 Figma 文本至平台，并上传截图；
  2. UI 本地化：将 Figma 设计稿显示为其他语言界面，检查多语言界面效果；


阅读使用指南，了解详细操作详见 用户手册


-------------------------


What is Volcengine Internationalization platform?


Volcengine Internationalization platform under Volcano Engine provides users with efficient and professional [Platform + Service] solutions, simplifies the Localization management process, improves the efficiency of multilingual content management, and helps product Internationalization transformation.


Go Internationalization platform


What is Volcano for Figma?


Volcano for Figma, a Figma plugin that enables UI localization, and push strings and screenshots between the Internationalization platform and Figma. Experience or content designers can push Figma text as source string to the Internationalization platform, support Key definition, upload screenshots, etc. At the same time, the plugin can quickly display the design draft as an interface in different languages through machine translation (MT) or platform's translation, helps check multilingual effects, saves communication costs between designers, product managers, translators and developers, which helps teams deliver multilingual products efficiently.


This plugin allows you to:

  1. Scan and push Figma text to the internationalization platform, and upload screenshots;
  2. UI localization: Display the Figma design as an interface in other languages, and check the effect of the multilingual interface;


Check User documentation for more information
plugins.tagline: content, i18n, internationalization, i10n, localization, language, translation, translate, ux
